alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:07PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Morgan, Johnson, northern Floyd and Magoffin Counties through 1145 PM EST... At 1106 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Adele to Eugene to near Lambric. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hendricks, Fritz, Tiptop, Carver Station, Foraker, Gullett, Ova and Stella around 1110 PM EST. Mason, Lakesville, Harper, Swampton, Carver, Conley Station, Royalton, Bethanna, Sublett and West Royalton Station around 1115 PM EST. Salyersville, Cisco, Gypsy, Bloomington, Burning Fork, Marshallville, Mashfork, Wonnie, Bradley and Matthew around 1120 PM EST. Ballot, Plutarch, Ever, Grayfox, Coon, Quod, Conley, Orient, Tella and Brainard around 1125 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Minefork, Lacey, Win, Bonanza, Denver, Patrick, Ophir, Dobson, Leander, Barnetts Creek, East Point, Oaklawn Estates, Staffordsville, Auxier, Bays Branch, Elna, Fitz, Collista, Hagerhill, West Van Lear, Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Tutor Key, Thelma, Flatgap, Thealka, Nero, Bobbs, Van Lear, Odds, River, Chandlerville, Whitehouse, Offutt, Sip, Winifred, Boons Camp, Kerz, Wells Chapel and Chestnut. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 60 and 76. Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 13 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
